moreover.translation[0].definitions[0].d: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said
moreover.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
moreover.translation[0].definitions[0].n: Moreover is very formal. In everyday English, people use what’s more or also instead:
The rent is reasonable and, what’s more, the location is perfect.
